title: Who should decide?
creator_contributor_role: National Film Board of Canada, production company
description: Episode of Series "A Discussion in bioethics". One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. This film deals with questions arising from advances in pre-natal diagnosis. Joanne, a victim of spina bifida, discovers that her unborn child has the same disease. A decision whether to terminate the pregnancy must be reached quickly. When her husband says that all he ever wanted was "a normal baby," Joanne counters with "What is normal?"
related_objects: Series; S01407; A Discussion in bioethics; Active; 1986
